meanings.definition: To plow or cultivate the layer of soil beneath the topsoil.
meanings.sent1: The farmer subsoiled the field to prepare it for planting.
meanings.sent2: It is important to subsoil the land before sowing the seeds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit subsoiled the garden, leaving a mess for the gardener to clean up.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like a plow subsoiling through any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tractor subsoiling the earth stayed vividly in his mind.

meanings.definition: Soil that has been plowed or cultivated beneath the topsoil.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used the subsoiled soil to enrich the garden beds.
meanings.sent2: The subsoiled area yielded a bountiful harvest this season.
meanings.sent3: The children found joy in playing in the subsoiled dirt, unaware of its farming history.
meanings.sent4: The hidden treasures of the subsoiled land were waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the subsoiled earth brought back memories of hard work and growth.
